intro: Galium anglicum var. leiocarpum, commonly known as white bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its characteristic appearance. Galium anglicum var. leiocarpum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream sides.
